instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this board with no power issue. It had a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> specifically <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> was burned and I replaced it, but also before that as i was following the short i took out <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and then resoldered it. Now the short in gone but it's stuck on 5v. I have all the LDO lines on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>(CD3215A)... Any ideas?

Thanks  ðŸ––

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Also the voltage on the gate of <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> is higher then <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL>(the source) Bad <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Dead CPU for sure; overvoltage went trough <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: I replaced <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> still same so as you said CPU probably :D Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
if overvoltage went through short <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> most likely you will have shorted these pins on your burned ic.
[ATTACH type="full"]60161[/ATTACH]

That can be probably a quick check for a dead cpu :/

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Yes it was a dead CPU. I notified client :D Thanks for the help guys
